properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: The first heat event of the season continues this evening and will last through Tuesday. Temperatures will reach 29 degrees Celsius this evening, before falling to 18 degrees Celsius tonight. Temperatures on Tuesday will reach 29 degrees Celsius again before a cooler air mass moves in to the region. ### Extreme heat affects everyone. The risks are greater for young children, pregnant women, older adults, people with chronic illnesses and people working or exercising outdoors. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-06-09T18:05:09-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-06-09T02:06:09-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3371465308.2020
Area: Upsala - Raith, Atikokan - Shebandowan - Quetico Park, Kakabeka Falls - Whitefish Lake - Arrow Lake
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of dangerous thunderstorms that may be capable of producing damaging wind gusts and damaging hail. ### Very large hail can damage property, break windows, dent vehicles and cause serious injury. Very strong wind gusts can damage buildings, down trees and blow large vehicles off the road. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm. For more information: http://www.emergencymanagementontario.ca/english/beprepared/beprepared.html.
Expires: 2020-06-09T08:59:37-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-06-09T02:43:42-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0423154011.2020
Area: Red Lake - Woodland Caribou Park, Ear Falls - Perrault Falls - Western Lac Seul, Savant Lake - Sturgeon Lake, Sioux Lookout - Eastern Lac Seul
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: First heat event of the year expected Tuesday through Wednesday. A hot airmass approaching the area will bring daytime temperatures in the low thirties over the next couple of days. With increasing humidity on Wednesday, humidex values are expected to creep in the mid to high thirties. Lows between 20 and 22 degrees Celsius are also expected Tuesday night. Temperatures will cool off Wednesday night as Tropical Depression Cristobal approaches Ontario. ### Extreme heat affects everyone. The risks are greater for young children, pregnant women, older adults, people with chronic illnesses and people working or exercising outdoors. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-06-09T18:06:03-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-06-09T02:07:03-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2292585131.2020

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: First heat event of the year expected Tuesday. Daytime high temperatures are expected to reach 30 degrees Celsius tomorrow with humidex values near 36. Cooler air will move in on Wednesday as Tropical Depression Cristobal approaches. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-06-09T18:52:29-00:00

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 02:40 UTC, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing very strong wind gusts, nickel to ping pong ball size hail and heavy rain. The thunderstorm is located near Wannaska, 35 km south of the US border and is moving northeast at 70 km/h. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles.

properties.Title: Squall Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Severe thunderstorms are expected to continue late this evening into the overnight hours. These thunderstorms may be capable of producing damaging wind gusts of 50 knots or more along with very large hail. There is also a risk of a tornado. ### Large hail can damage vessels and cause injury. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.
Expires: 2020-06-09T09:14:58-00:00

properties.Title: Tornado Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms which may produce tornadoes. Hazards: - A few tornadoes. - Ping pong ball to tennis ball size hail. - Damaging wind gusts of 100 to 130 km/h. Locations: Portions of Northwestern Ontario near and south of Highway 17 including Kenora, Dryden and Fort Frances. Timing: Late this afternoon through late this evening. Remember, a Tornado Watch means tornadoes and severe thunderstorms are possible in and close to the watch area. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm. For more information: http://www.emergencymanagementontario.ca/english/beprepared/beprepared.html.

properties.Title: Tornado Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms which may produce tornadoes. Hazards: - Risk of a tornado. - Ping pong ball to tennis ball size hail. - Damaging wind gusts of 50 to 65 knots. Locations: Lake of the Woods. Timing: Through late this evening. Remember, a Tornado Watch means tornadoes and severe thunderstorms are possible in and close to the watch area. Mariners are advised to prepare for severe thunderstorms which may produce tornadoes, large hail and damaging wind gusts. Vulnerable vessels are most at risk and should seek safe harbour if underway. Consider postponing travel or boating activities in areas under the tornado watch. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.
Expires: 2020-06-09T06:59:20-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-06-09T02:52:20-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4192191826.2020
Area: Lake of the Woods
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Tornado Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 9:20 p.m. CDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm that is possibly producing a tornado. Damaging winds, large hail and locally intense rainfall are also possible. Very dangerous thunderstorms in the Lower Manitou Lake and Gold Rock areas are moving northeast at 60 km/h. Hazard: Tornadoes and tennis ball sized hail. Locations impacted include: Gold Rock, Lower Manitou Lake and surrounding areas. Additional thunderstorms are located north of this thunderstorm moving northeast at 60 km/h. Hazard: Nickel sized hail. Locations impacted include: Dryden, Aaron Provincial Park, Wabigoon, Dinorwic and Dyment. ### This is a dangerous and potentially life-threatening situation.
Expires: 2020-06-09T03:33:31-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-06-09T02:21:31-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4293294213.2020

properties.Title: Frost Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Frost may damage some crops in frost-prone areas. Minimum temperatures: plus 2. Location: northwestern New Brunswick. Time span: late tonight and early Tuesday morning. Remarks: Patchy frost is expected to form tonight as clear skies and light winds coincide with cool temperatures. Frost is likely again Tuesday night into Wednesday morning. ### Frost advisories are issued when temperatures are expected to reach the freezing mark during the growing season, leading to potential damage and destruction to plants and crops. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NBStorm.
Expires: 2020-06-09T11:19:40-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-06-09T02:49:40-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1973198585.2020
Area: Edmundston and Madawaska County, western half of Restigouche County, Campbellton and eastern half of Restigouche County, Grand Falls and Victoria County, Mount Carleton - Renous Highway

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions this evening are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms over southeastern Manitoba. These thunderstorms may be capable of producing hail to the size of golf balls, wind gusts in excess of 100 km/h and heavy rain. The most severe thunderstorms are possible through this evening. Some localities in this district have received over 100 mm of rainfall over the couple of days. Some shower and thunderstorm activity is likely through the night and well into Tuesday. ### Very large hail can damage property, break windows, dent vehicles and cause serious injury. Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to MBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #MBStorm.
Expires: 2020-06-09T13:00:07-00:00
